xchange_client.XChangeClient

class xchange_client.XChangeClient(host: str, username: str, password: str, silent: bool = False)

A basic bot that can be used to interface with the 2024 UTC Xchange. Participants can subclass this bot to implement specific functionality and trading logic.

__init__(host: str, username: str, password: str, silent: bool = False)

Initializes the bot :param host: Host server where the exchange is being run :param username: Participant’s username :param password: Participant’s password

Methods

__init__(host, username, password[, silent])

Initializes the bot :param host: Host server where the exchange is being run :param username: Participant's username :param password: Participant's password

bot_handle_book_update(symbol)

Function for the user to fill in if they want to have any action upon receiving book updates.

bot_handle_cancel_response(order_id, ...)

Function for the user to fill in if they want to have any additional actions upon receiving a CancelOrderResponse.

bot_handle_order_fill(order_id, qty, price)

Function for the user to fill in if they want to have any additional actions upon receiving an OrderFillMessage.

bot_handle_order_rejected(order_id, reason)

Function for the user to fill in if they want to have any additional actions upon receiving an OrderRejectedMessage.

bot_handle_swap_response(swap, qty, success)

Function for the user to fill in if they want to have any additional actions upon receiving a SwapResponse.

bot_handle_trade_msg(symbol, price, qty)

Function for the user to fill in if they want to have any action upon receiving a TradeMessage.

cancel_order(order_id)

Places a cancel order request for the given order id :param order_id: order_id of the order to cancel :return:

connect()

Connects to the server using the username and password from initialization.

handle_authenticate_response(msg)

Handler for authentication response.

handle_book_snapshot(msg)

Update the books based on full snapshot from the exchange.

handle_book_update(msg)

Updates the book based on the incremental updates to the books provided by the exchange.

handle_cancel_response(msg)

Processes a cancel order response and calls the users handler.

handle_order_fill(msg)

Updates the positions based on the order fill.

handle_order_rejected(msg)

Calls the users order rejection handler and then removes it from the open orders.

handle_position_snapshot(msg)

Copy over positions from the exchange records

handle_swap_response(msg)

Updates positions if swap was successful.

handle_trade_msg(msg)

Calls the bot trade message handler.

place_order(symbol, qty, side[, px])

Function to place an order on the exchange.

place_swap_order(swap, qty)

Places a swap request with the exchange.

process_message(msg)

Identifies message type and calls the appropriate message handler.
